intro: Anemia oblongifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved anemia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
